channel.title: How to play PSX (Playstation One) games on your computer
channel.description:
Alright, after finishing the following tut you should be able to play PSX games (Playstation One) on your computer.
*Note I will not be providing a link to any type of warez etc, in this tutorial!
[b]Step 1. Downloading the Emulator[/b]
Alright go over to [url=http://www.epsxe.com/download.php]Here[/url] and download ePSXe 1.6
Save it somewhere that is easy to access for the moment.
After downloading it, extract it. [b]Step 2. Obtaining the BIOs[/b]
In order to run ePSXe you need the PSX BIOs. I [u][b]can not[/b][/u] provide you with a link to this file, because the only way to legally obtain this would be to dump it from your Playstation One at home, onto your computer.
So in order to obtain this file [url=http://google.com]Use Google[/url]. Search for scph1001.bin, once you have obtained this file, put it in the folder "bios" in the epsxe160 folder. It should be 512kb. You can also delete the "erase me" file, its just a place holder.
[IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/bios.jpg[/img]
[b]Step 3. Obtaining the video plugins[/b]
This step is pretty easy...download the plugins [url=http://www.emuxhaven.net/emuxhaven/psx/plugin/gpupete176.zip]here[/url] Then extract all the .dll files to the "plugins" folder in the epsxe160 folder.
There should be 3 files now in the plugins folder: gpuPeteD3D.dll, gpuPeteDX6D3D.dll, and gpuPeteOpenGL.dll Again delete the placeholder (remove.me)
[b]Step 4. Configuring the plugins![/b] Start up epsxe.exe
Go to config-> Wizard Guide [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/guide.jpg[/img] click on Config >>
If its not highlighted highlight scph1001 (the bios file) [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/guide2.jpg[/img] Then click Next >>
Now highlight Pete's D3D Driver 1.76, then click the "config" button A window like this should come up. Set yours up to match mine. These are the "best performance settings" from the ePSXe forums. [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/video.jpg[/img] when your done and everything is setup like mine, click "ok"
Now click Next >> Highlight ePSXe SPU core 1.5.2 [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/sound.jpg[/img] click Next >> Now highlight either ePSXe CDR ASPI core 1.5.2 or ePSXe CDR WNT/W2K core 1.5.2 depending on your operating system.
Win9x/Me should use ePSXe CDR ASPI core 1.5.2
Win2k/NT should use ePSXe CDR WNT/W2K core 1.5.2
So basically unless your using a Windows 90 something or Windows Me, use the second choice. [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/cdrom.jpg[/img] Click Next >> Now here is where you could configure your controllers, click on Controller 1 or Controller 2 and the rest is pretty self-explanatory.
When your done with that click Next >> then Done
[b]BUT WAIT[/b] One last thing to do. Go to Config -> Sound
Then Enable CDDA Sound and XA Sound, leave SPU IRQ hack unchecked click OK
[b]Congratulations! You have successfully setup a PSX Emulator![/b]
[b]Step 5. Playing the games!!!![/b] Now there are two ways you can play the PSX Games.
1. Either pop in the game in your cd-drive and then go File -> Run CDROM *[b]Do not[/b] select this unless a PSX Game is in your cd-drive and has been loaded, or else ePSXe will lock up!
2. Or obtain a .iso .cue, or a .bin of a Playstation game. OR make one yourself using an image making program such as Alcohol 120% or Nero *Again I [i][b]will not[/b][/i] provide any links to sites that provide Playstation .iso downloads, find them yourselves. Anyway once you have the file go to File -> Run ISO then select your .bin .cue or .iso of the game.
Once you have selected the file, ePSXe should go to full-screen and begin playing the game, no problems. If you expreince a problem starting or playing a PSX game (graphical issues, sudden crashing, etc.) refer to the [url=http://forums.ngemu.com/epsxe-compatibility/49711-compatibility-list-epsxe-1-6-0-a.html]Compatibility List[/url] and configure your plugins accordingly.
There is also a handful of games that will not run, period. There is about 10 of them, again refer to the [url=http://forums.ngemu.com/epsxe-compatibility/49711-compatibility-list-epsxe-1-6-0-a.html]Compatibility List[/url] they will be highlighted in red.
Proof this actually works :P (In link because its a desktop screenshot) [url=http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/proof-2.jpg]Proof[/url]
Feel free to send me [b]LINKS[/b] to pictures of you playing a PSX game on your desktop, I'll then put them here as more proof. :) Just go to Config -> video and select Windowed Mode instead of Fullscreen Mode.
Post any questions you have, or problems you encounter while following this guide, and I will try and answer them.
Now go! Amaze your friends!
Sources: www.epsxe.com www.emuxhaven.net http://forums.ngemu.com/ www.photobucket.com =P

item.title: How to play PSX (Playstation One) games on your computer
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

K sorry about this, I just realized what I said. I guess I was having a dyslexic moment…I meant I paid around 21$ for it…heh :o…I then actually found the box and I paid 20 for it. Reason its so up there is because its Wireless. There where other Pc Controllers there for about sixteen$ (spelled it this time)

Although I just went to the Wal-Mart website and found they were selling it there for 18$…

Sorry about that…

Read full topic

god i need a usb xbox controller or something…
[/quote]

Yea after I set all this up I went out to Wal-Mart and bought one for like 12$ lol
Mine actually looks like a Playstation controller too…

Heres a picture:
[/quote]
god that is so worth it
just $12

item.title: How to play PSX (Playstation One) games on your computer
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

[quote=“haxerownsmopar, post:6, topic:159397”]there is 1 for the ps2 but its buggy as hell + slow

btw ive known about this for years and the ps1 emu is too god dam fast[/quote]

You have your FPS up to high. Same thing happened to me. Set it to auto and it’ll work fine.

For some odd reason the default is 200 and normal is like 60 X.X

Read full topic

item.title: How to play PSX (Playstation One) games on your computer
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Alright, after finishing the following tut you should be able to play PSX games (Playstation One) on your computer.

*Note I will not be providing a link to any type of warez etc, in this tutorial!

Step 1. Downloading the Emulator

Alright go over to Here and download ePSXe 1.6

Save it somewhere that is easy to access for the moment.

After downloading it, extract it.
Step 2. Obtaining the BIOs

In order to run ePSXe you need the PSX BIOs.
I can not provide you with a link to this file, because the only way to legally obtain this would be to dump it from your Playstation One at home, onto your computer.

So in order to obtain this file Use Google. Search for scph1001.bin, once you have obtained this file, put it in the folder “bios” in the epsxe160 folder. It should be 512kb. You can also delete the “erase me” file, its just a place holder.

Step 3. Obtaining the video plugins

This step is pretty easy…download the plugins here
Then extract all the .dll files to the “plugins” folder in the epsxe160 folder.

There should be 3 files now in the plugins folder:
gpuPeteD3D.dll, gpuPeteDX6D3D.dll, and gpuPeteOpenGL.dll
Again delete the placeholder (remove.me)

Step 4. Configuring the plugins!
Start up epsxe.exe

Go to config-> Wizard Guide

click on Config >>

If its not highlighted highlight scph1001 (the bios file)

Then click Next >>

Now highlight Pete’s D3D Driver 1.76, then click the “config” button
A window like this should come up. Set yours up to match mine. These are the “best performance settings” from the ePSXe forums.

when your done and everything is setup like mine, click “ok”

Now click Next >>
Highlight ePSXe SPU core 1.5.2

click Next >>
Now highlight either ePSXe CDR ASPI core 1.5.2 or ePSXe CDR WNT/W2K core 1.5.2 depending on your operating system.

Win9x/Me should use ePSXe CDR ASPI core 1.5.2

Win2k/NT should use ePSXe CDR WNT/W2K core 1.5.2

So basically unless your using a Windows 90 something or Windows Me, use the second choice.

Click Next >>
Now here is where you could configure your controllers, click on Controller 1 or Controller 2 and the rest is pretty self-explanatory.

When your done with that click Next >> then Done

BUT WAIT
One last thing to do.
Go to Config -> Sound

Then Enable CDDA Sound and XA Sound, leave SPU IRQ hack unchecked
click OK

Congratulations! You have successfully setup a PSX Emulator!

Step 5. Playing the games!!!
Now there are two ways you can play the PSX Games.

  1. Either pop in the game in your cd-drive and then go File -> Run CDROM
    *Do not select this unless a PSX Game is in your cd-drive and has been loaded, or else ePSXe will lock up!

  2. Or obtain a .iso .cue, or a .bin of a Playstation game. OR make one yourself using an image making program such as Alcohol 120% or Nero
    *Again I will not provide any links to sites that provide Playstation .iso downloads, find them yourselves.
    Anyway once you have the file go to File -> Run ISO then select your .bin .cue or .iso of the game.

Once you have selected the file, ePSXe should go to full-screen and begin playing the game, no problems.
If you expreince a problem starting or playing a PSX game (graphical issues, sudden crashing, etc.) refer to the Compatibility List and configure your plugins accordingly.

There is also a handful of games that will not run, period. There is about 10 of them, again refer to the Compatibility List they will be highlighted in red.

Proof this actually works (In link because its a desktop screenshot)
Proof

Feel free to send me LINKS to pictures of you playing a PSX game on your desktop, I’ll then put them here as more proof.
Just go to Config -> video and select Windowed Mode instead of Fullscreen Mode.

Post any questions you have, or problems you encounter while following this guide, and I will try and answer them.

Now go! Amaze your friends!

Sources:
www.epsxe.com
www.emuxhaven.net
http://forums.ngemu.com/
www.photobucket.com =P

Read full topic
